event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item:
Use fmdump -v -e -u EVENT_ID to get information on the detected error(s).

The event-id can be found in the EVENT-ID field of the message.

For example:

    EVENT-ID: d05a9f16-e969-4988-d340-dea1b54bd307

Contact your service provider for further diagnosis.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: Errors have been detected on multiple memory modules, suggesting that a problem exists somewhere else in the system.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
The Message ID:   %MSGID% indicates that the Solaris[TM] Fault Manager has received reports that multiple DIMMS are experiencing errors. Open a call with your Sun Service provider in order to have these errors examined further.

Some additional information can be gathered by running :

fmdump -v -e -u EVENT_ID

Note: You may also be requested to provide a copy of the files in the /var/fm/fmd directory and also a copy of the output from the fmadm config command.

Sun Fire Midrange and High End notes:

There may be additional fault information logged by System Controller Application (ScApp) on Sun Fire[TM] Midrange (3800, 48x0, 6800, v1280, E2900, E4900, E6900) and System Management Services (SMS) on High End (12K, 15K, E20K, E25K) Servers. Availability enhancements (called AVL) have been integrated into ScApp 5.19.0 and SMS 1.5 to allow FMA/AVL interaction to coexist.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: System performance and stability may be affected.
event_registry_properties.name: po-action
event_registry_properties.item: Contact your service provider for further diagnosis.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: Error reports from the affected components will be logged for examination by Sun.
event_registry_properties.name: title
